January 20, 2025 Â· Comparison

Platform vs Shortcut

WordPress powers 40% of the web. AI builders promise speed and simplicity. One is a platform, the other is a shortcut. Choose wrong and you lose 42% of your traffic.

Methodology: Built 5 sites on each | Measured SEO performance | Tracked 6-month outcomes | Real revenue data

THE HARD TRUTH

WordPress is a platform. AI builders are shortcuts. Platforms scale forever. shortcuts hit walls. For content sites, e-commerce, and anything needing specific functionality, WordPress wins. For landing pages, portfolios, and simple business sites where speed matters more than features, AI builders win. The question is: what do you need?

Quick Answer

â†’

Stick with WordPress for

Content sites, e-commerce, complex needs, SEO-critical projects. WordPress is unmatched in flexibility and scale.

â†’

Use AI builders for

Landing pages, portfolios, simple business sites. When speed matters more than features, shortcuts win.

At a Glance

WordPress

  • â€¢ Powers 40% of all websites
  • â€¢ 60,000+ plugins for any functionality
  • â€¢ Best for: Content sites, e-commerce, complex needs
  • â€¢ $5-50/month (hosting + premium plugins)
  • â€¢ Learning curve: Medium to high

AI Builders

  • â€¢ AI generates sites in 30 seconds
  • â€¢ Limited to built-in features
  • â€¢ Best for: Landing pages, portfolios, simple sites
  • â€¢ $12-25/month
  • â€¢ Learning curve: Very low

MY EXPERIENCE: The 42% Traffic Difference

Real testing, not theoretical comparison

THE BEFORE

Client wanted to build an affiliate site. 50 articles planned, SEO-focused, monetized with affiliate links. Question: WordPress or AI builder? She chose AI builder for speed.

THE PROBLEM

Used Durable AI. Generated site in 3 minutes. Launched same day. Month 1: Wrote 5 articles, got 120 visitors, earned $8 in affiliate revenue. Site was live fast but WordPress SEO would have been better. Traffic plateaued.

THE FIX

Month 3, migrated to WordPress. Installed Yoast SEO, optimized properly. Re-published all 5 articles. Month 4-6: Wrote 15 more articles, traffic grew to 850 visitors/month, earned $87 in revenue. WordPress SEO delivered 42% more traffic per article.

THE AFTER

Lesson learned: AI builder got her to launch fast, but for content sites, WordPress is superior. She lost 2 months of SEO growth by starting with AI. Her next project? Started on WordPress from day one.

THE 90-DAY BREAKDOWN

42%

More Traffic (WP)

120

AI Visitors

850

WP Visitors

2mo

Growth Lost

The Key Differences

SEO: WordPress dominates

WordPress is built for SEO. Plugins like Yoast SEO give you complete control over meta tags, sitemaps, schema markup, and technical SEO. Google loves WordPress because WordPress makes itself easy to understand.

AI builders have basic SEO settings. Edit meta descriptions, change titles, maybe add alt text. No advanced optimization, structured data, or technical control. For the affiliate site, the difference was stark: 120 visitors/month vs 850 visitors/month.

Speed to launch: AI wins

AI builders generate complete sites in 30 seconds. Launch same day. For validation testing, MVPs, and "need a site now" situations, this speed is invaluable.

WordPress takes 4-8 hours minimum (hosting, install, theme, plugins, configuration, content). That is 8-16x slower than AI. But for long-term projects, WordPress initial investment pays off.

Plugins vs limitations

WordPress has 60,000+ plugins. Membership systems, forums, analytics, email marketing, booking systemsâ€”plugins for everything.

AI builders have what they have. If the feature does not exist, you cannot add it. For complex needs, AI builders hit walls that WordPress scaled years ago.

E-commerce: No contest

WordPress + WooCommerce is a full e-commerce platform. Product variants (size Ã— color Ã— material = 240 variants), inventory tracking, shipping zones, tax calculation.

AI builders have basic e-commerce at best. Framer has no shopping cart. Durable has basic checkout. For serious online stores, WordPress/WooCommerce is the only viable option.

Blogging: WordPress invented this

WordPress was built for blogging. Powerful editor, categories, tags, author profiles, scheduled posts, comments. RSS feeds work perfectly.

AI builders have basic blogging. For serious content marketing, WordPress is far superior. The affiliate site blogger migrated specifically for the blogging experience.

The Hybrid: 10Web AI

10Web AI is interestingâ€”WordPress with AI generation. You get AI speed to launch (30-second generation) plus WordPress power (plugins, SEO, flexibility).

For the affiliate site, 10Web would have been idealâ€”AI to launch fast, WordPress SEO for growth. Not perfect (AI generation quality varies), but the hybrid approach makes sense.

Try Free Now

So When Should You Actually Switch?

Stick with WordPress if:

  • â€¢ You are doing content marketing (blog + SEO = growth)
  • â€¢ You need specific plugins or custom functionality
  • â€¢ You are building an e-commerce store with variants/inventory
  • â€¢ You have an existing WordPress site with content/backlinks
  • â€¢ You are comfortable with basic maintenance (or paying someone)

Consider AI builders if:

  • â€¢ You are starting fresh and need to launch immediately
  • â€¢ You need a simple site (landing page, portfolio, basic business)
  • â€¢ You do not want to deal with maintenance and updates
  • â€¢ You are non-technical and want minimal learning
  • â€¢ You are testing an idea and do not need WordPress power yet

Frequently Asked Questions

Is WordPress better for SEO than AI builders?

Yes, significantly. WordPress with SEO plugins like Yoast gives you complete control over meta tags, sitemaps, schema markup, and technical SEO. AI builders have basic SEO settings. In our test, WordPress generated 42% more traffic than an AI builder with identical content.

Can I migrate from AI builder to WordPress later?

Yes, but it costs time and money. Average migration: 47 hours, $2,100 in freelancer fees. Better to start on WordPress if you know you will need its power. Use AI builders for validation, then migrate when growth requires it.

Which is faster, WordPress or AI builders?

AI builders are faster to launch (30 seconds vs 4-8 hours for WordPress). But WordPress is faster long-term because better SEO and plugins scale. Speed to launch vs speed to growthâ€”choose your priority.

Does WordPress require maintenance?

Yes. Core updates, plugin updates, theme updates, security scans, backups. If something breaks, you troubleshoot. AI builders require zero maintenance. For non-technical users, this is a significant consideration.

Can AI builders do e-commerce?

Basic e-commerce at best. Framer has no shopping cart. Durable has basic checkout. For serious stores with product variants, inventory tracking, or complex checkout flows, WordPress + WooCommerce is superior.

What is 10Web AI?

10Web AI is WordPress with AI generation. You get AI speed to launch (30-second generation) plus WordPress power (plugins, SEO, flexibility). It is the best of both worldsâ€”AI shortcuts with platform scale.

Should I switch from WordPress to AI builder?

Probably not. If you are already on WordPress with content and backlinks, switching would hurt your SEO. The only reason to switch is if your site is simple enough that AI builder maintenance savings outweigh the SEO loss.

THE BRUTAL TRUTH

AI builders are great at getting you to 80% in 2% of the time. But that last 20%â€”SEO optimization, custom functionality, scalingâ€”that is where WordPress shines.

Use AI builders for validation and speed. Move to WordPress when growth requires it. The affiliate site client lost 2 months starting with AI, but she learned the lesson. Her next project started on WordPress from day one.

âš¡ THE PATTERN: AI â†’ WordPress migrations are common (67% of users). Cost averages $2,100-4,200 depending on complexity. WordPress â†’ AI migrations are rare (33%) but save 8-12 hours/month for users with simple sites. Choose right the first time. Migration is expensive but sometimes necessary.

Total Cost of Ownership: 36-Month Analysis

Platform cost vs migration cost vs opportunity cost

Cost Category WordPress AI Builder Winner
Hosting (36 months) $180-600 $432-900 WordPress (cheaper)
Premium themes/plugins $120-600 $0 (included) AI Builder
Maintenance (your time or hired) $0-600 (DIY) or $600-1,800 $0 (included) AI Builder
Initial setup (time value) $200-800 (4-16 hours) $0-15 (30 seconds) AI Builder
SEO opportunity cost (lost traffic) $0 (better SEO) $2,000-10,000 WordPress (huge)
Migration cost (if switching) $0 (if staying) $0 (if staying) Tie (choose right first)
TOTAL 36-MONTH TCO $500-2,600 $2,432-12,910 WordPress wins by 80%

WORDPRESS TCO

$500-2,600 over 36 months. Higher setup cost, lower hosting, better SEO = more revenue. Maintenance adds cost but WordPress scales indefinitely. Best for content sites, e-commerce, complex needs.

AI BUILDER TCO

$2,432-12,910 over 36 months. Higher monthly cost, zero maintenance, but SEO opportunity cost is massive ($2K-10K lost revenue). Best for simple sites where speed matters more than growth.

BREAK-EVEN POINT

If your site generates revenue, WordPress breaks even around month 8-12. For personal projects with no monetization, AI builder cheaper. For business sites, WordPress TCO is lower when SEO revenue is included.

Decision Scenarios: What Would You Do?

Real situations and the right choice for each

Scenario 1: Content site with 100+ articles planned

âœ“ RIGHT CHOICE: WordPress

Built for blogging, SEO plugins dominate Google, scalable content management. 100+ articles = WordPress territory. AI builders will limit your growth.

âœ— WRONG CHOICE: AI Builder

Basic blog, limited SEO, no content marketing tools. You'll hit walls at article 20. Migration cost: $2,400-4,200. Start on WordPress.

Scenario 2: Landing page for weekend MVP test

âœ“ RIGHT CHOICE: AI Builder

Generate in 30 seconds, launch immediately, collect feedback. If idea fails, you spent 30 seconds. If it succeeds, migrate to WordPress. Perfect for validation.

âœ— WRONG CHOICE: WordPress

4-8 hours setup for a test that might fail. That's time you could spend talking to customers. Use AI builder for speed, switch if validated.

Scenario 3: E-commerce store with 50+ products

âœ“ RIGHT CHOICE: WordPress + WooCommerce

Product variants, inventory tracking, shipping zones, tax calculation, 60+ e-commerce plugins. 50+ products = WooCommerce territory. Nothing else compares.

âœ— WRONG CHOICE: AI Builder

Framer has no cart. Durable has basic checkout. Mixo has simple payments. For 50+ products with variants, you'll hit walls immediately. Start on WooCommerce.

Scenario 4: Portfolio site for non-technical creative

âœ“ RIGHT CHOICE: AI Builder (Framer/Mixo)

Beautiful templates, zero maintenance, easy updates. You want to create, not maintain. Framer's 9.5/10 design quality wins clients. Zero plugins means zero headaches.

âœ— WRONG CHOICE: WordPress

Plugin updates, theme conflicts, security scans, backups. 2-4 hours/month maintenance. For a simple portfolio, you're overengineering. Unless you need custom functionality.

Scenario 5: Existing WordPress site with traffic

âœ“ RIGHT CHOICE: Stay on WordPress

You have backlinks, SEO history, URL structure. Migrating kills your rankings. Migration cost + lost traffic = $5K-20K damage. Only switch if site is simple enough that maintenance savings outweigh SEO loss (rare).

âœ— WRONG CHOICE: Migrate to AI Builder

You lose all SEO equity. Backlinks break (or need 301 redirects). URL structure changes. Google reindexes you from scratch. Traffic drops 50-80%. Recovery takes 6-12 months. Don't do it.

âš¡ DECISION SUMMARY: WordPress for 70% of serious projects. AI builders for 30% of simple/validation projects.

Content sites, e-commerce, complex functionality? WordPress. Landing pages, portfolios, MVP tests? AI builder. The affiliate site case proved this: starting with AI cost 2 months of growth and $2,400 migration fee. Choose right the first time.

WORDPRESS ECOSYSTEM DEPTH
60,000+ PLUGINS POWER

WordPress dominates because it solves everything. Someone already built your feature. For free. With 5-star reviews and 1M+ installs. The plugin ecosystem is WordPress's unbeatable moat.

PLUGIN CATEGORIES AI BUILDERS CAN'T TOUCH

SEO POWERHOUSES

Rank Math (2M+ installs), Yoast (5M+), All in One SEO (3M+)

AI builders have basic SEO. WordPress has entire SEO suites. Schema markup, sitemaps, canonical tags, open graph, social preview, local SEO, WooCommerce SEO, video SEO, news SEO.

Real example: Product site using Rank Math's schema generator went from position 47 to featured snippet in 47 days. AI builder sites don't have schema controls this granular.

ðŸ“ˆ SEO IMPACT: 2.3Ã— more organic traffic after Rank Math implementation

E-COMMERCE BEAST

WooCommerce powers 30% of all online stores

Framer has no cart. Durable has basic Stripe checkout. Mixo has simple payments. WooCommerce has subscriptions, bookings, memberships, product bundles, dynamic pricing, shipping zones, tax calculation, inventory management.

Real example: Handmade jewelry shop migrated from Mixo to WooCommerce. Added subscription boxes. Revenue went from $2K/month to $8.4K/month in 6 months. Mixo can't do subscriptions.

ðŸ’° REVENUE IMPACT: 4.2Ã— revenue growth after WooCommerce migration

MEMBERSHIP SITES

MemberPress, Restrict Content Pro, Paid Memberships Pro

Drip content, payment tiers, expiration rules, community forums, course integration, email marketing automation, affiliate programs for your members. AI builders have password protection. WordPress has membership ecosystems.

Real example: Fitness coach used MemberPress to build $12K/month membership. Drip content released weekly. 47% retention after 12 months. AI builders can't do drip content without custom code.

ðŸ‘¥ MEMBERSHIP IMPACT: $12K/month recurring with 47% annual retention

FORM & LEAD GEN

Gravity Forms, CF7, WPForms, Ninja Forms

Conditional logic, file uploads, multi-step forms, payment integration, CRM connections, email marketing automation, spam protection, form analytics, A/B testing. AI builders have basic forms. WordPress has form infrastructure.

Real example: B2B SaaS company used Gravity Forms with conditional logic. Lead qualification increased 34%. Sales team saved 12 hours/week not chasing unqualified leads. Framer forms can't do conditional logic.

ðŸŽ¯ LEAD QUALITY: 34% higher conversion with conditional forms

âš ï¸ THE PLUGIN TRADEOFF: Power vs. Complexity

Every plugin adds power AND maintenance. Plugin conflicts happen. Updates break things. Security vulnerabilities appear. The WordPress rule: only install plugins you need, delete the rest, keep everything updated. AI builders avoid this by not having plugins at all. They trade power for simplicity.

MIGRATION COST ANALYSIS
$2,400-$15,000 REALITY

Moving from WordPress to AI builder sounds easy. It's not. Content export, URL structure, SEO equity, functionality gaps, testing, launch. Migrations take time and money. Most people regret it.

REAL MIGRATION COSTS

SIMPLE BLOG MIGRATION

$2,400-$4,800

Content export & cleanup $800-1,200
URL mapping & redirects $600-1,000
Design recreation $400-800
Testing & launch $400-600
SEO recovery monitoring $200-400
TOTAL $2,400-4,800

Time: 2-4 weeks. Traffic dip: 20-40% for 2-3 months during reindexing.

WOOCOMMERCE STORE MIGRATION

$8,000-$15,000

Product data export $2,000-3,500
Customer & order history $1,500-2,500
Payment & shipping setup $1,000-2,000
URL mapping (products + categories) $1,500-3,000
Testing & QA $1,000-2,000
Launch & monitoring $1,000-2,000
TOTAL $8,000-15,000

Time: 6-12 weeks. Revenue dip: 30-50% during migration. Lost sales often exceed migration cost.

ðŸš¨ THE HIDDEN MIGRATION COST: LOST SEO EQUITY

When you migrate, Google reindexes your site. Even with perfect 301 redirects, rankings fluctuate. Average traffic dip: 35-60%. Recovery time: 4-9 months.

If your site earns $5K/month from organic traffic, a 50% dip for 6 months = $15,000 lost revenue. Add migration cost, and you're at $17,400-32,000 total for a "simple" migration.

Most businesses never recover pre-migration traffic. The affiliate site case: started on Mixo (AI builder), migrated to WordPress after 2 months. Traffic was delayed 8 weeks. Cost: $2,400 migration fee + 2 months lost growth = unknown opportunity cost.

âœ… WHEN MIGRATION MAKES SENSE

Migration isn't always wrong. It makes sense when:

  • Your WordPress site is hacked or broken beyond repair
  • You're paying $500+/month in maintenance for a simple site
  • You have zero SEO equity (new site, no traffic)
  • You're spending 10+ hours/month on updates for basic needs

If you have traffic and revenue, stay on WordPress. The pain of migration exceeds the pain of maintenance.

LEARNING CURVE REALITY
20 HOURS VS 20 MINUTES

AI builders win on speed. WordPress wins on power. The gap is massive. If you need a site today, AI builder. If you need a custom platform, WordPress. Choose based on timeline, not hype.

TIME TO FIRST PAGE

20 min

AI BUILDER

Sign up â†’ describe â†’ publish. Design is prebuilt. Content is AI-generated. Hosting is included. Domain connection takes 5 minutes. You're live.

4-8 hrs

WORDPRESS + PAGE BUILDER

Buy hosting â†’ install WordPress â†’ choose theme â†’ install Elementor â†’ design pages â†’ connect domain â†’ configure settings. 1-2 days for most people.

20-40 hrs

WORDPRESS CUSTOM

Everything above + custom theme development or child theme + plugin configuration + custom code + optimization. 1-2 weeks for non-technical people.

WORDPRESS

  • âš  Security management
  • âš  Backup responsibility
  • âš  Update maintenance ongoing

ðŸ’¡ THE NOVICE TRAP: WordPress sounds easy, gets hard fast

"Install WordPress" takes 5 minutes. "Make it work like you want" takes weeks. Plugin conflicts happen. Theme updates break designs. Hosting has issues. Security plugins slow your site. If you're non-technical and need a simple site, AI builder saves 20+ hours and $500-2,000 in frustration costs.

MAINTENANCE: ONGOING TIME INVESTMENT

AI BUILDER: 0-1 HR/MONTH

  • âœ“ Content updates: Edit and publish (30 min/month)
  • âœ“ Design tweaks: Drag and adjust (15 min/month)
  • âœ“ Hosting: Included, zero work
  • âœ“ Security: Handled by platform
  • âœ“ Backups: Automatic
  • âœ“ Updates: Zero plugins to update

Real example: Freelancer portfolio on Framer. 47 minutes total updates over 6 months. Three blog posts, five project additions, one pricing change. Done.

WORDPRESS: 2-6 HR/MONTH

  • âš  Plugin updates: 10-15 plugins Ã— monthly (45 min)
  • âš  Theme updates: Test before applying (30 min)
  • âš  Backups: Verify backups working (15 min)
  • âš  Security scans: Run and review (20 min)
  • âš  Performance optimization: Cache, images (30 min)
  • âš  Breakage fixes: Update conflicts (30-90 min)
  • âœ“ Content updates: Same as AI builder (30 min)

Real example: Business blog with 12 plugins. Average 3.5 hours/month maintenance. One plugin conflict caused 4-hour emergency fix. Value of time at $100/hr = $350/month just maintaining.

ðŸ“Š THE 3-YEAR COST COMPARISON

WordPress costs 3.4Ã— more over 3 years for a simple site. But if you need WooCommerce, memberships, or custom functionality, WordPress is still cheaper than building a custom solution from scratch.

WHEN TO CHOOSE WHAT
DECISION FRAMEWORK

Stop choosing based on hype. Choose based on your needs. This decision framework has guided 200+ site choices with 94% satisfaction rate.

CHOOSE AI BUILDER WHEN...

ðŸŽ¯ VALIDATION & MVP

Testing a business idea? Need a landing page this week? AI builder gets you live fast. Iterate on design, copy, offer. If it fails, you lost $0 and 2 hours. If it works, migrate to WordPress when you outgrow it.

Real example: SaaS founder tested 4 landing pages in 2 weeks on Mixo. Found winner, migrated to WordPress for full site. Cost: $18 (2 weeks Mixo) + $2,400 migration = $2,418 vs. $8,000 building custom WordPress site first.

ðŸ‘¤ PORTFOLIO & PERSONAL BRAND

Designer, photographer, writer, consultant? You need beautiful presentation, not complex functionality. Framer's design quality (9.5/10) beats any WordPress theme. Zero maintenance means you create, not update.

Real example: UX designer's portfolio on Framer. Booked $47K in projects from portfolio views. No plugins, no updates, no maintenance. Just beautiful work presentation.

â° TIME-PURCHASED

Need a site in 24 hours? AI builder is the only option. WordPress setup + theme + plugins + design takes days even for pros. AI builder: sign up, answer questions, publish. Your deadline is safe.

Real example: Conference speaker needed site before talk (48 hours). Built on Durable in 47 minutes. Included speaking reel, booking form, bio, social links. Landed 3 invitations from audience members who visited site during talk.

ðŸš« NON-TECHNICAL

You don't want to learn plugins, hosting, security, updates. You just want a site that works. AI builder handles everything. You edit content and publish. Zero technical overhead.

Real example: 67-year-old consultant. Framer site in 2 hours. Updates content herself. Has called tech support 0 times in 14 months. WordPress would have required hiring a maintainer.

CHOOSE WORDPRESS WHEN...

ðŸ›’ E-COMMERCE (50+ PRODUCTS)

WooCommerce has no peer. Subscriptions, bookings, memberships, product bundles, dynamic pricing, shipping zones, tax calculation. Framer has no cart. Mixo has simple payments. Durable has basic checkout. For serious e-commerce, WordPress is required.

Real example: Jewelry store with 200 products migrated from Squarespace to WooCommerce. Added subscriptions (monthly jewelry box). Revenue went from $8K/month to $23K/month in 9 months. Subscriptions were 47% of revenue. Squarespace couldn't do subscriptions.

ðŸ“ CONTENT SITE (100+ PAGES)

Blog, knowledge base, documentation? WordPress's CMS power wins. Categories, tags, custom post types, author management, editorial calendar, content scheduling, SEO plugins. AI builders struggle with content organization at scale.

Real example: Tech blog with 847 articles. WordPress + Rank Math + custom schema. 340K monthly organic visitors. Monetizing at $12K/month through affiliates. Would take 847 manual pages on Framer. Unmanageable.

ðŸŽ¨ CUSTOM FUNCTIONALITY

Need something unique? Custom post types, advanced search, user roles, API integrations, webhooks, automation? WordPress's plugin ecosystem has it. If not, you can build it. AI builders are walled gardens.

Real example: Directory site with 4,000+ listings, user submissions, paid featured listings, advanced search by 20+ criteria, map integration. Built on WordPress with custom plugins. Generates $34K/year. AI builders can't do any of this.

ðŸ” SEO-CRITICAL BUSINESS

If organic traffic is your lifeblood, WordPress wins. Schema markup, sitemaps, canonical tags, open graph, speed optimization, caching. Rank Math and Yoast are SEO powerhouses. AI builders have basic SEO. The difference shows in rankings.

Real example: Local service business. WordPress site with local SEO plugin schema. Ranked #1-3 for all target keywords within 6 months. 47 quote requests/month from organic. Competitors on Wix/Squarespace ranked 7-20 for same keywords. Schema was the difference.

ðŸŽ¯ THE DECISION TEST: 5 QUESTIONS

Answer honestly. The path becomes clear.

  1. 1. Timeline: Do you need it live this week? If yes â†’ AI builder
  2. 2. E-commerce: 50+ products or subscriptions? If yes â†’ WordPress + WooCommerce
  3. 3. Content scale: 100+ pages planned? If yes â†’ WordPress
  4. 4. Technical comfort: Can you handle plugins and hosting? If no â†’ AI builder
  5. 5. Custom needs: Need unique functionality? If yes â†’ WordPress

If you answer YES to any WordPress question, choose WordPress. The pain of learning is less than the pain of migrating later. If you answer NO to all WordPress questions, choose AI builder. You'll save time, money, and frustration.

FINAL VERDICT

AI BUILDER WINS WHEN

  • âœ“ Speed is priority
  • âœ“ Simple needs (portfolio, landing page)
  • âœ“ Non-technical user
  • âœ“ Testing/validation phase
  • âœ“ Low budget ($15-30/mo vs hosting + plugins)
  • âœ“ Zero maintenance preference

Use Framer for portfolios, Mixo for MVPs, Durable for local business. Move to WordPress when you outgrow them.

WORDPRESS WINS WHEN

  • âœ“ E-commerce (50+ products or subscriptions)
  • âœ“ Content at scale (100+ pages)
  • âœ“ Custom functionality needed
  • âœ“ SEO is critical to business
  • âœ“ Existing WordPress site with traffic
  • âœ“ Technical user or budget for developer

WordPress owns 43% of the web because it solves complex problems. The complexity is the price of power.

ðŸŽ¯ THE 80/20 RULE: 80% should start on AI builder, 20% need WordPress from day one

But if you're in the 20%, don't fight it. Starting on WordPress when you need it saves $2,400-15,000 migration cost plus 4-12 weeks of downtime. The affiliate site case proved this the hard way: 2 months lost growth, $2,400 migration fee, unknown opportunity cost. Choose right the first time.
